results.title: Philippines my Philippines
results.creator_credit: Chris Nash, Maree Delofski and Stoney Desert
results.brief_description: In 1988 three years after a triumphal wave of “people power” swept away the Marcos regime and installed Cory Aquino as Head of State, what is the real situation in the Philippines? Human rights abuses are rife, trade unions are being repressed, poverty and violence are spiralling upwards. This documentary contrasts the hopes of the revolution with the realities of prostitution and the absence of genuine land reform. It shows the connections between slumdwellers organising themselves and the rise of vigilante death squads, between a foreign investment boom and police strike-breakers, between Australian development aid to poor peasants and counter-insurgency strategies. The film combines startling images of beauty and terror with the story of a people betrayed.

results.title: Talking hands 2. Parts 1-9 (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Viewers are introduced to signed English by teaching signs for 300 words most commonly used. Includes practice with short sentences. The vocabulary of the original Talking Hands is extended by 400 signs in Talking Hands 2.

results.title: Signs of Life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Brisbane College of Advanced Education AV Prod Unit
results.brief_description: The Australian Deaf Community has been an unknown and misunderstood minority group for far too long. In this lively, informative video, the stereotypes are blown away. Here we see deaf people leading normal, purposeful lives, participating in a wide range of activities which their thriving community supports and talking about their lives with inspiring candour, insight and humour.

results.title: Delia Smith`s Home Baking
results.brief_description: Delia Smith’s no nonsense approach to baking strips away the mystique which too often shrouds the subject. Delia covers the entire range of homebaked goodies: bread, pastry, biscuits and cakes. Stick to Delia’s methods and you’ll soon be able to bake successfully anything from wholemeal bread to choux pastry. Rated: G

results.title: The Secret country: the first Australians fight back (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: According to John Pilger, “Australia is a secret country with a secret history.” This documentary looks at that history, the history of Australian First Nations peoples from the time of white settlement to the present, and reveals the extent of the cruelty and injustice inflicted upon them. The central issue throughout the film is the differing perspectives on the land and its uses, providing historical background to the present land rights movement and other areas of activism.

results.title: A Sense of Direction (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A look at the sport of orientating. It starts by describing map-marking and how important accurate maps are. Shows maps being made for orienteering, based on grades of difficulty that orienteers are subjected to. It concludes with the maps being used in an actual race.

results.title: The Empire strikes back (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The battle to save the galaxy from the evil Darth Vader rages on in this spellbinding Star Wars sequel. In a spectacular opening battle the Rebels suffer a devastating attack by an Imperial Army using ATAT walkers. Hans Solo, Princess Leia and Chewbacca survive, and fight a running space battle against Imperial ships while Luke Skywalker seeks out Yoda, the ancient Jedi Master, to be trained as a true Jedi Knight. Rated: PG Caption Version only Available.

results.title: Return of the Jedi (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Light sabres hum and sparkle, the Millennium flashes through hyperspace in the blink of an eye, and creatures from the end of the galaxy prepare for battle against the oppressive Imperial Forces in this stunning third chapter of the space saga that has become the most popular trilogy ever filmed. Caption version only available. Rated: PG

results.title: The Space movie
results.creator_credit: Tony Palmer, Richard Branson and Simon Draper
results.brief_description: The Space Movie contains footage especially made available by NASA and the US National Archive, and includes never before seen colour film of the lunar landscape, man’s historic first walk on the moon, Mars, Venus and beyond. Music by Mike Oldfield.

results.title: Man of letters
results.brief_description: Professor Dorton Serry, played by Warren Mitchell, is a Man of Letters. An esteemed philosopher and lover of all women, he controls his world absolutely. So how does he react when the women in his life step out of their allotted roles and challenge his prejudices and philosophies of life? Adapted from the novel by Glen Tomasetti.
